newsitem.title: FRANCE: Eurotunnel sets French shareholder hotline.
newsitem.headline: Eurotunnel sets French shareholder hotline.

text.p: Channel Tunnel operator Eurotunnel SA/Plc said on Thursday it has set up a special telephone line for French small investors to support its July 10 shareholders' meeting which will vote on its debt restructuring.
Eurotunnel is also launching a financial information campaign in the press, to get as many shareholders as possible to take part in the meeting, it said in a statement.
Shareholders can use the telephone hot line to ask for documents including the restructuring prospectus, voting forms and a guide to shareholder meetings.

"Following the many difficulties encountered last year by our shareholders in taking part in our meetings, I have personally asked the stock market authorities to ensure that similar problems will not recur," Eurotunnel executive chairman Patrick Ponsolle said in the statement.

"The exceptional measure that we have put in place this year is the result of our official consultations. I hope that it will allow a high level of shareholder participation in decisions that concern them directly," he said.
Eurotunnel has 721,000 small shareholders, of which around 600,000 are in France.
The company needs a two thirds majority of French shareholder and 75 percent of British investors to approve the refinancing of its 70 billion francs of junior bank debt.
The terms include a dilution of existing shareholders down to 54.5 percent of the capital, with new shares to being issued to creditor banks in exchange for eight billion francs of debt.

Eurotunnel last week presented its restructuring prospectus and said it could pay a first dividend in 2006 if it makes a net profit in 2005, using what it called a "base case". That compares to a forecast first payout in 2003 in its prospectus for the 1994 rights issue.
